ISM-0724.description: The CISO implements cyber security measurement metrics and key performance indicators for their organisation.

ISM-0725.name: Chief Information Security Officer
ISM-0725.description: The CISO coordinates cyber security and business alignment through a cyber security steering committee or advisory board, comprising of key cyber security and business executives, which meets formally and on a regular basis.

ISM-0726.name: Chief Information Security Officer
ISM-0726.description: The CISO coordinates security risk management activities between cyber security and business teams.

ISM-0731.name: Chief Information Security Officer
ISM-0731.description: The CISO oversees cyber supply chain risk management activities for their organisation.

ISM-0732.name: Chief Information Security Officer
ISM-0732.description: The CISO receives and manages a dedicated cyber security budget for their organisation.

ISM-0733.name: Chief Information Security Officer
ISM-0733.description: The CISO is fully aware of all cyber security incidents within their organisation.

ISM-0734.name: Chief Information Security Officer
ISM-0734.description: The CISO contributes to the development, implementation and maintenance of business continuity and disaster recovery plans for their organisation to ensure that business-critical services are supported appropriately in the event of a disaster.

ISM-0735.name: Chief Information Security Officer
ISM-0735.description: The CISO oversees the development, implementation and maintenance of their organisation’s cyber security awareness training program.

ISM-0810.name: Facilities and systems
ISM-0810.description: Systems are secured in facilities that meet the requirements for a security zone suitable for their classification.

ISM-0813.name: Facilities and systems
ISM-0813.description: Server rooms, communications rooms, security containers and secure rooms are not left in unsecured states.

ISM-0817.name: Cyber security awareness training
ISM-0817.description: Personnel are advised of what suspicious contact via online services is and how to report it.

ISM-0820.name: Cyber security awareness training
ISM-0820.description: Personnel are advised to not post work information to unauthorised online services and to report cases where such information is posted.

ISM-0821.name: Cyber security awareness training
ISM-0821.description: Personnel are advised of security risks associated with posting personal information to online services and are encouraged to use any available privacy settings to restrict who can view such information.

ISM-0824.name: Cyber security awareness training
ISM-0824.description: Personnel are advised not to send or receive files via unauthorised online services.

ISM-0829.name: Facilities and systems
ISM-0829.description: Security measures are used to detect and respond to unauthorised RF devices in SECRET and TOP SECRET areas.

ISM-0831.name: Media usage
ISM-0831.description: Media is handled in a manner suitable for its sensitivity or classification.

ISM-0835.name: Media sanitisation
ISM-0835.description: Following sanitisation, TOP SECRET volatile media retains its classification if it stored static data for an extended period of time, or had data repeatedly stored on or written to the same memory location for an extended period of time.

ISM-0836.name: Media sanitisation
ISM-0836.description: Non-volatile EEPROM media is sanitised by overwriting it at least once in its entirety with a random pattern followed by a read back for verification.

ISM-0839.name: Media destruction
ISM-0839.description: The destruction of media storing accountable material is not outsourced.

ISM-0840.name: Media destruction
ISM-0840.description: When outsourcing the destruction of media storing non-accountable material, a National Association for Information Destruction AAA certified destruction service with endorsements, as specified in ASIO’s Protective Security Circular-167, is used.

ISM-0843.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-0843.description: Application control is implemented on workstations.

ISM-0846.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-0846.description: All users (with the exception of local administrator accounts and break glass accounts) cannot disable, bypass or be exempted from application control.

ISM-0853.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-0853.description: On a daily basis, outside of business hours and after an appropriate period of inactivity, user sessions are terminated and workstations are restarted.

ISM-0854.name: Access to systems and their resources
ISM-0854.description: AUSTEO and AGAO data can only be accessed from systems under the sole control of the Australian Government that are located within facilities authorised by the Australian Government.

ISM-0859.name: Event logging and monitoring
ISM-0859.description: Event logs, excluding those for Domain Name System services and web proxies, are retained for at least seven years.

ISM-0861.name: Email gateways and servers
ISM-0861.description: DKIM signing is enabled on emails originating from an organisation’s domains (including subdomains).

ISM-0863.name: Mobile device management
ISM-0863.description: Mobile devices prevent personnel from installing non-approved applications once provisioned.

ISM-0864.name: Mobile device management
ISM-0864.description: Mobile devices prevent personnel from disabling or modifying security functionality once provisioned.

ISM-0866.name: Mobile device usage
ISM-0866.description: Sensitive or classified data is not viewed or communicated in public locations unless care is taken to reduce the chance of the screen of a mobile device being observed.

ISM-0869.name: Mobile device management
ISM-0869.description: Mobile devices encrypt their internal storage and any removable media.

ISM-0870.name: Mobile device usage
ISM-0870.description: Mobile devices are carried or stored in a secured state when not being actively used.

ISM-0871.name: Mobile device usage
ISM-0871.description: Mobile devices are kept under continual direct supervision when being actively used.

ISM-0874.name: Enterprise mobility
ISM-0874.description: Mobile devices and desktop computers access the internet via a VPN connection to an organisation’s internet gateway rather than via a direct connection to the internet.

ISM-0888.name: Development and maintenance of security documentation
ISM-0888.description: Security documentation is reviewed at least annually and includes a ‘current as at [date]’ or equivalent statement.

ISM-0917.name: Responding to cyber security incidents
ISM-0917.description:
When malicious code is detected, the following steps are taken to handle the infection:
 • the infected systems are isolated
 • all previously connected media used in the period leading up to the infection are scanned for signs of infection and isolated if necessary
 • antivirus software is used to remove the infection from infected systems and media
 • if the infection cannot be reliably removed, systems are restored from a known good backup or rebuilt.

ISM-0926.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-0926.description: OFFICIAL: Sensitive and PROTECTED cables are coloured neither salmon pink nor red.

ISM-0931.name: Telephone systems
ISM-0931.description: In SECRET and TOP SECRET areas, push-to-talk handsets or push-to-talk headsets are used to meet any off-hook audio protection requirements.

ISM-0938.name: User application hardening
ISM-0938.description: User applications are chosen from vendors that have demonstrated a commitment to secure-by-design and secure-by-default principles, use of memory-safe programming languages where possible, secure programming practices, and maintaining the security of their products.

ISM-0947.name: Media usage
ISM-0947.description: When transferring data manually between two systems belonging to different security domains, rewritable media is sanitised after each data transfer.

ISM-0955.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-0955.description: Application control is implemented using cryptographic hash rules, publisher certificate rules or path rules.

ISM-0958.name: Web content filters
ISM-0958.description: An organisation-approved list of domain names, or list of website categories, is implemented for all Hypertext Transfer Protocol and Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure traffic communicated through gateways.

ISM-0961.name: Web content filters
ISM-0961.description: Client-side active content is restricted by web content filters to an organisation-approved list of domain names.

ISM-0963.name: Web content filters
ISM-0963.description: Web content filtering is implemented to filter potentially harmful web-based content.

ISM-0971.name: Web application development
ISM-0971.description: The OWASP Application Security Verification Standard is used in the development of web applications.

ISM-0974.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-0974.description: Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate unprivileged users of systems.

ISM-0988.name: Event logging and monitoring
ISM-0988.description: An accurate time source is established and used consistently across systems to assist with identifying connections between events.

ISM-0991.name: Event logging and monitoring
ISM-0991.description: Event logs for Domain Name System services and web proxies are retained for at least 18 months.

ISM-0994.name: ASD-Approved Cryptographic Algorithms
ISM-0994.description: ECDH is used in preference to DH.

ISM-0998.name: Internet Protocol Security
ISM-0998.description: AUTH_HMAC_SHA2_256_128, AUTH_HMAC_SHA2_384_192, AUTH_HMAC_SHA2_512_256 or NONE (only with AES-GCM) is used for authenticating IPsec connections, preferably NONE.

ISM-0999.name: Internet Protocol Security
ISM-0999.description: DH or ECDH is used for key establishment of IPsec connections, preferably 384-bit random ECP group, 3072-bit MODP Group or 4096-bit MODP Group.

ISM-1000.name: Internet Protocol Security
ISM-1000.description: PFS is used for IPsec connections.

ISM-1006.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1006.description: Security measures are implemented to prevent unauthorised access to network management traffic.

ISM-1013.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1013.description: The effective range of wireless communications outside an organisation’s area of control is limited by implementing RF shielding on facilities in which SECRET or TOP SECRET wireless networks are used.

ISM-1014.name: Video conferencing and Internet Protocol telephony
ISM-1014.description: Individual logins are implemented for IP phones used for SECRET or TOP SECRET conversations.

ISM-1019.name: Video conferencing and Internet Protocol telephony
ISM-1019.description: A denial of service response plan for video conferencing and IP telephony services is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1023.name: Email usage
ISM-1023.description: The intended recipients of blocked inbound emails, and the senders of blocked outbound emails, are notified.

ISM-1024.name: Email gateways and servers
ISM-1024.description: Notifications of undeliverable emails are only sent to senders that can be verified via SPF or other trusted means.

ISM-1026.name: Email gateways and servers
ISM-1026.description: DKIM signatures on incoming emails are verified.

ISM-1027.name: Email gateways and servers
ISM-1027.description: Email distribution list software used by external senders is configured such that it does not break the validity of the sender’s DKIM signature.

ISM-1028.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1028.description: A NIDS or NIPS is deployed in gateways between an organisation’s networks and other networks they do not manage.

ISM-1030.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1030.description: A NIDS or NIPS is located immediately inside the outermost firewall for gateways and configured to generate event logs and alerts for network traffic that contravenes any rule in a firewall ruleset.

ISM-1034.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1034.description: A HIPS is implemented on critical servers and high-value servers.

ISM-1036.name: Fax machines and multifunction devices
ISM-1036.description: Fax machines and MFDs are located in areas where their use can be observed.

ISM-1037.name: Gateways
ISM-1037.description: Gateways undergo testing following configuration changes, and at regular intervals no more than six months apart, to validate they conform to expected security configurations.

ISM-1053.name: Facilities and systems
ISM-1053.description: Servers, network devices and cryptographic equipment are secured in server rooms or communications rooms that meet the requirements for a security zone suitable for their classification.

ISM-1055.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1055.description: LAN Manager and NT LAN Manager authentication methods are disabled.

ISM-1059.name: Media usage
ISM-1059.description: All data stored on media is encrypted.

ISM-1065.name: Media sanitisation
ISM-1065.description: The host-protected area and device configuration overlay table are reset prior to the sanitisation of non-volatile magnetic hard drives.

ISM-1067.name: Media sanitisation
ISM-1067.description: The ATA secure erase command is used, in addition to block overwriting software, to ensure the growth defects table of non-volatile magnetic hard drives is overwritten.

ISM-1071.name: System owners
ISM-1071.description: Each system has a designated system owner.

ISM-1073.name: Managed services and cloud services
ISM-1073.description: An organisation’s systems, applications and data are not accessed or administered by a service provider unless a contractual arrangement exists between the organisation and the service provider to do so.

ISM-1074.name: Facilities and systems
ISM-1074.description: Keys or equivalent access mechanisms to server rooms, communications rooms, security containers and secure rooms are appropriately controlled.

ISM-1075.name: Fax machines and multifunction devices
ISM-1075.description: The sender of a fax message makes arrangements for the receiver to collect the fax message as soon as possible after it is sent and for the receiver to notify the sender if the fax message does not arrive in an agreed amount of time.

ISM-1076.name: IT equipment sanitisation and destruction
ISM-1076.description: Televisions and computer monitors with minor burn-in or image persistence are sanitised by displaying a solid white image on the screen for an extended period of time.

ISM-1078.name: Telephone systems
ISM-1078.description: A telephone system usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1079.name: IT equipment maintenance and repairs
ISM-1079.description: ASD’s approval is sought before undertaking any maintenance or repairs to high assurance IT equipment.

ISM-1080.name: Cryptographic fundamentals
ISM-1080.description: An ASD-Approved Cryptographic Algorithm (AACA) or high assurance cryptographic algorithm is used when encrypting media.

ISM-1082.name: Mobile device usage
ISM-1082.description: A mobile device usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1083.name: Mobile device usage
ISM-1083.description: Personnel are advised of the sensitivity or classification permitted for voice and data communications when using mobile devices.

ISM-1084.name: Mobile device usage
ISM-1084.description: If unable to carry or store mobile devices in a secured state, they are physically transferred in a security briefcase or an approved multi-use satchel, pouch or transit bag.

ISM-1085.name: Mobile device management
ISM-1085.description: Mobile devices encrypt all sensitive or classified data communicated over public network infrastructure.

ISM-1088.name: Mobile device usage
ISM-1088.description:
Personnel report the potential compromise of mobile devices, removable media or credentials to their organisation as soon as possible, especially if they:
 • provide credentials to foreign government officials
 • decrypt mobile devices for foreign government officials
 • have mobile devices taken out of sight by foreign government officials
 • have mobile devices or removable media stolen, including if later returned
 • lose mobile devices or removable media, including if later found
 • observe unusual behaviour of mobile devices.

ISM-1089.name: Email usage
ISM-1089.description: Protective marking tools do not allow users replying to or forwarding emails to select protective markings lower than previously used.

ISM-1091.name: Cryptographic fundamentals
ISM-1091.description: Keying material is changed when compromised or suspected of being compromised.

ISM-1092.name: Fax machines and multifunction devices
ISM-1092.description: Separate fax machines or MFDs are used for sending sensitive or classified fax messages and all other fax messages.

ISM-1095.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1095.description: Wall outlet boxes denote the systems, cable identifiers and wall outlet box identifier.

ISM-1096.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1096.description: Cables are labelled at each end with sufficient source and destination details to enable the physical identification and inspection of the cable.

ISM-1098.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1098.description: SECRET cables are terminated in an individual cabinet; or for small systems, a cabinet with a division plate between any SECRET cables and non-SECRET cables.

ISM-1100.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1100.description: TOP SECRET cables are terminated in an individual TOP SECRET cabinet.

ISM-1101.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1101.description: In TOP SECRET areas, cable reticulation systems leading into cabinets in server rooms or communications rooms are terminated as close as possible to the cabinet.

ISM-1102.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1102.description: Cable reticulation systems leading into cabinets are terminated as close as possible to the cabinet.

ISM-1103.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1103.description: In TOP SECRET areas, cable reticulation systems leading into cabinets not in server rooms or communications rooms are terminated at the boundary of the cabinet.

ISM-1105.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1105.description: SECRET and TOP SECRET wall outlet boxes contain exclusively SECRET or TOP SECRET cables.

ISM-1107.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1107.description: OFFICIAL: Sensitive and PROTECTED wall outlet boxes are coloured neither salmon pink nor red.

ISM-1109.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1109.description: Wall outlet box covers are clear plastic.

ISM-1111.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1111.description: Fibre-optic cables are used for cabling infrastructure instead of copper cables.

ISM-1112.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1112.description: Cables are inspectable at a minimum of five-metre intervals.

ISM-1114.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1114.description: Cable bundles or conduits sharing a common cable reticulation system have a dividing partition or visible gap between each cable bundle and conduit.

ISM-1115.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1115.description: Cables from cable trays to wall outlet boxes are run in flexible or plastic conduit.

ISM-1116.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1116.description: A visible gap exists between TOP SECRET cabinets and non-TOP SECRET cabinets.

ISM-1119.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1119.description: Cables in TOP SECRET areas are fully inspectable for their entire length.

ISM-1122.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1122.description: Where wall penetrations exit a TOP SECRET area into a lower classified area, TOP SECRET cables are encased in conduit with all gaps between the TOP SECRET conduit and the wall filled with an appropriate sealing compound.

ISM-1123.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1123.description: A power distribution board with a feed from an Uninterruptible Power Supply is used to power all TOP SECRET IT equipment.

ISM-1130.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1130.description: In shared facilities, cables are run in an enclosed cable reticulation system.

ISM-1133.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1133.description: In shared facilities, TOP SECRET cables are not run in party walls.

ISM-1137.name: Emanation security
ISM-1137.description: System owners deploying SECRET or TOP SECRET systems within fixed facilities contact ASD for an emanation security threat assessment.

ISM-1139.name: Transport Layer Security
ISM-1139.description: Only the latest version of TLS is used for TLS connections.

ISM-1143.name: System patching
ISM-1143.description: Patch management processes, and supporting patch management procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1145.name: Mobile device usage
ISM-1145.description: Privacy filters are applied to the screens of SECRET and TOP SECRET mobile devices.

ISM-1146.name: Cyber security awareness training
ISM-1146.description: Personnel are advised to maintain separate work and personal accounts for online services.

ISM-1151.name: Email gateways and servers
ISM-1151.description: SPF is used to verify the authenticity of incoming emails.

ISM-1157.name: Diodes
ISM-1157.description: Evaluated diodes are used for controlling the data flow of unidirectional gateways between networks.

ISM-1158.name: Diodes
ISM-1158.description: Evaluated diodes used for controlling the data flow of unidirectional gateways between SECRET or TOP SECRET networks and any other networks complete a high assurance evaluation.

ISM-1160.name: Media destruction
ISM-1160.description: If using degaussers to destroy media, degaussers evaluated by the United States’ National Security Agency are used.

ISM-1163.name: System-specific security documentation
ISM-1163.description:
Systems have a continuous monitoring plan that includes:
 • conducting vulnerability scans for systems at least fortnightly
 • conducting vulnerability assessments and penetration tests for systems prior to deployment, including prior to deployment of significant changes, and at least annually thereafter
 • analysing identified vulnerabilities to determine their potential impact
 • implementing mitigations based on risk, effectiveness and cost.

ISM-1164.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1164.description: In shared facilities, conduits or the front covers of ducts, cable trays in floors and ceilings, and associated fittings are clear plastic.

ISM-1171.name: Web content filters
ISM-1171.description: Attempts to access websites through their IP addresses instead of their domain names are blocked by web content filters.

ISM-1173.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1173.description: Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate privileged users of systems.

ISM-1175.name: Access to systems and their resources
ISM-1175.description: Privileged accounts (excluding those explicitly authorised to access online services) are prevented from accessing the internet, email and web services.

ISM-1178.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1178.description: Network documentation provided to a third party, or published in public tender documentation, only contains details necessary for other parties to undertake contractual services.

ISM-1181.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1181.description: Networks are segregated into multiple network zones according to the criticality of servers, services and data.

ISM-1182.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1182.description: Network access controls are implemented to limit the flow of network traffic within and between network segments to only that required for business purposes.

ISM-1183.name: Email gateways and servers
ISM-1183.description: A hard fail SPF record is used when specifying authorised email servers (or lack thereof) for an organisation’s domains (including subdomains).

ISM-1186.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1186.description: IPv6 capable network security appliances are used on IPv6 and dual-stack networks.

ISM-1187.name: Data transfers
ISM-1187.description: When manually exporting data from systems, the data is checked for unsuitable protective markings.

ISM-1192.name: Gateways
ISM-1192.description: Gateways inspect and filter data flows at the transport and above network layers.

ISM-1195.name: Mobile device management
ISM-1195.description: Mobile Device Management solutions that have completed a Common Criteria evaluation against the Protection Profile for Mobile Device Management, version 4.0 or later, are used to enforce mobile device management policy.

ISM-1196.name: Mobile device usage
ISM-1196.description: OFFICIAL: Sensitive and PROTECTED mobile devices are configured to remain undiscoverable to other Bluetooth devices except during Bluetooth pairing.

ISM-1198.name: Mobile device usage
ISM-1198.description: Bluetooth pairing for OFFICIAL: Sensitive and PROTECTED mobile devices is performed in a manner such that connections are only made between intended Bluetooth devices.

ISM-1199.name: Mobile device usage
ISM-1199.description: Bluetooth pairings for OFFICIAL: Sensitive and PROTECTED mobile devices are removed when there is no longer a requirement for their use.

ISM-1200.name: Mobile device usage
ISM-1200.description: Bluetooth pairing for OFFICIAL: Sensitive and PROTECTED mobile devices is performed using Secure Connections, preferably with Numeric Comparison if supported.

ISM-1211.name: System administration
ISM-1211.description: System administrators document requirements for administrative activities, consider potential security impacts, obtain any necessary approvals, notify users of any disruptions or outages, and maintain system and security documentation.

ISM-1213.name: Responding to cyber security incidents
ISM-1213.description: Following intrusion remediation activities, full network traffic is captured for at least seven days and analysed to determine whether malicious actors have been successfully removed from the system.

ISM-1216.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1216.description: SECRET and TOP SECRET cables with non-conformant cable colouring are banded with the appropriate colour and labelled at inspection points.

ISM-1217.name: IT equipment disposal
ISM-1217.description: Labels and markings indicating the owner, sensitivity, classification or any other marking that can associate IT equipment with its prior use are removed prior to its disposal.

ISM-1218.name: IT equipment sanitisation and destruction
ISM-1218.description: IT equipment, including associated media, that is located overseas and has processed, stored or communicated AUSTEO or AGAO data, is sanitised in situ.

ISM-1219.name: IT equipment sanitisation and destruction
ISM-1219.description: MFD print drums and image transfer rollers are inspected and destroyed if there is remnant toner which cannot be removed or a print is visible on the image transfer roller.

ISM-1220.name: IT equipment sanitisation and destruction
ISM-1220.description: Printer and MFD platens are inspected and destroyed if any text or images are retained on the platen.

ISM-1221.name: IT equipment sanitisation and destruction
ISM-1221.description: Printers and MFDs are checked to ensure no pages are trapped in the paper path due to a paper jam.

ISM-1222.name: IT equipment sanitisation and destruction
ISM-1222.description: Televisions and computer monitors that cannot be sanitised are destroyed.

ISM-1223.name: IT equipment sanitisation and destruction
ISM-1223.description:
Memory in network devices is sanitised using the following processes, in order of preference:
 • following device-specific guidance provided in evaluation documentation
 • following vendor sanitisation guidance
 • loading a dummy configuration file, performing a factory reset and then reinstalling firmware.

ISM-1225.name: IT equipment sanitisation and destruction
ISM-1225.description: The paper tray of the fax machine is removed, and a fax message with a minimum length of four pages is transmitted, before the paper tray is re-installed to allow a fax summary page to be printed.

ISM-1226.name: IT equipment sanitisation and destruction
ISM-1226.description: Fax machines are checked to ensure no pages are trapped in the paper path due to a paper jam.

ISM-1227.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1227.description: Credentials set for user accounts are randomly generated.

ISM-1228.name: Event logging and monitoring
ISM-1228.description: Cyber security events are analysed in a timely manner to identify cyber security incidents.

ISM-1233.name: Internet Protocol Security
ISM-1233.description: IKE version 2 is used for key exchange when establishing IPsec connections.

ISM-1234.name: Email gateways and servers
ISM-1234.description: Email content filtering is implemented to filter potentially harmful content in email bodies and attachments.

ISM-1235.name: User application hardening
ISM-1235.description: Add-ons, extensions and plug-ins for office productivity suites, web browsers, email clients, PDF software and security products are restricted to an organisation-approved set.

ISM-1236.name: Web content filters
ISM-1236.description: Malicious domain names, dynamic domain names and domain names that can be registered anonymously for free are blocked by web content filters.

ISM-1237.name: Web content filters
ISM-1237.description: Web content filtering is applied to outbound web traffic where appropriate.

ISM-1238.name: Application development
ISM-1238.description: Threat modelling is used in support of application development.

ISM-1239.name: Web application development
ISM-1239.description: Robust web application frameworks are used in the development of web applications.

ISM-1240.name: Web application development
ISM-1240.description: Validation or sanitisation is performed on all input handled by web applications.

ISM-1241.name: Web application development
ISM-1241.description: Output encoding is performed on all output produced by web applications.

ISM-1243.name: Databases
ISM-1243.description: A database register is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

ISM-1245.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1245.description: All temporary installation files and logs created during server application installation processes are removed after server applications have been installed.

ISM-1246.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1246.description: Server applications are hardened using ASD and vendor hardening guidance, with the most restrictive guidance taking precedence when conflicts occur.

ISM-1247.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1247.description: Unneeded accounts, components, services and functionality of server applications are disabled or removed.

ISM-1249.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1249.description: Server applications are configured to run as a separate account with the minimum privileges needed to perform their functions.

ISM-1250.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1250.description: The accounts under which server applications run have limited access to their underlying server’s file system.

ISM-1255.name: Databases
ISM-1255.description: Database users’ ability to access, insert, modify and remove database contents is restricted based on their work duties.

ISM-1256.name: Databases
ISM-1256.description: File-based access controls are applied to database files.

ISM-1260.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1260.description: Default accounts or credentials for server applications, including for any pre-configured accounts, are changed.

ISM-1263.name: Access to systems and their resources
ISM-1263.description: Unique privileged accounts are used for administering individual server applications.

ISM-1268.name: Databases
ISM-1268.description: The need-to-know principle is enforced for database contents through the application of minimum privileges, database views and database roles.

ISM-1269.name: Database servers
ISM-1269.description: Database servers and web servers are functionally separated.

ISM-1270.name: Database servers
ISM-1270.description: Database servers are placed on a different network segment to user workstations.

ISM-1271.name: Database servers
ISM-1271.description: Network access controls are implemented to restrict database server communications to strictly defined network resources, such as web servers, application servers and storage area networks.

ISM-1272.name: Database servers
ISM-1272.description: If only local access to a database is required, networking functionality of database management system software is disabled or directed to listen solely to the localhost interface.

ISM-1273.name: Database servers
ISM-1273.description: Development and testing environments do not use the same database servers as production environments.

ISM-1274.name: Databases
ISM-1274.description: Database contents from production environments are not used in development or testing environments unless the environment is secured to the same level as the production environment.

ISM-1275.name: Web application development
ISM-1275.description: All queries to databases from web applications are filtered for legitimate content and correct syntax.

ISM-1276.name: Web application development
ISM-1276.description: Parameterised queries or stored procedures, instead of dynamically generated queries, are used by web applications for database interactions.

ISM-1277.name: Database servers
ISM-1277.description: Data communicated between database servers and web servers is encrypted.

ISM-1278.name: Web application development
ISM-1278.description: Web applications are designed or configured to provide as little error information as possible about the structure of databases.

ISM-1284.name: Content filtering
ISM-1284.description: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo content validation.

ISM-1286.name: Content filtering
ISM-1286.description: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo content conversion.

ISM-1287.name: Content filtering
ISM-1287.description: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo content sanitisation.

ISM-1288.name: Content filtering
ISM-1288.description: Files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs undergo antivirus scanning using multiple different scanning engines.

ISM-1289.name: Content filtering
ISM-1289.description: Archive files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs are unpacked in order to undergo content filtering checks.

ISM-1290.name: Content filtering
ISM-1290.description: Archive files are unpacked in a controlled manner to ensure content filter performance or availability is not adversely affected.

ISM-1293.name: Content filtering
ISM-1293.description: Encrypted files imported or exported via gateways or CDSs are decrypted in order to undergo content filtering checks.

ISM-1294.name: Data transfers
ISM-1294.description: Data transfer logs for systems are partially verified at least monthly.

ISM-1296.name: Facilities and systems
ISM-1296.description: Physical security is implemented to protect network devices in public areas from physical damage or unauthorised access.

ISM-1297.name: Enterprise mobility
ISM-1297.description: Legal advice is sought prior to allowing privately-owned mobile devices and desktop computers to access systems or data.

ISM-1298.name: Mobile device usage
ISM-1298.description: Personnel are advised of privacy and security risks when travelling overseas with mobile devices.

ISM-1299.name: Mobile device usage
ISM-1299.description:
Personnel are advised to take the following precautions when using mobile devices:
 • never leave mobile devices or removable media unattended, including by placing them in checked-in luggage or leaving them in hotel safes
 • never store credentials with mobile devices that they grant access to, such as in laptop computer bags
 • never lend mobile devices or removable media to untrusted people, even if briefly
 • never allow untrusted people to connect their mobile devices or removable media to your mobile devices, including for charging
 • never connect mobile devices to designated charging stations or wall outlet charging ports
 • never use gifted or unauthorised peripherals, chargers or removable media with mobile devices
 • never use removable media for data transfers or backups that have not been checked for malicious code beforehand
 • avoid reuse of removable media once used with other parties’ systems or mobile devices
 • avoid connecting mobile devices to open or untrusted Wi-Fi networks
 • consider disabling any communications capabilities of mobile devices when not in use, such as Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Near Field Communication and ultra-wideband
 • consider periodically rebooting mobile devices
 • consider using a VPN connection to encrypt all cellular and wireless communications
 • consider using encrypted email or messaging apps for all communications.

ISM-1300.name: Mobile device usage
ISM-1300.description:
Upon returning from travelling overseas with mobile devices, personnel take the following actions:
 • sanitise and reset mobile devices, including all removable media
 • decommission any credentials that left their possession during their travel
 • report if significant doubt exists as to the integrity of any mobile devices or removable media.

ISM-1304.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1304.description: Default accounts or credentials for network devices, including for any pre-configured accounts, are changed.

ISM-1311.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1311.description: SNMP version 1 and SNMP version 2 are not used on networks.

ISM-1312.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1312.description: All default SNMP community strings on network devices are changed and write access is disabled.

ISM-1314.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1314.description: All wireless devices are Wi-Fi Alliance certified.

ISM-1315.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1315.description: The administrative interface on wireless access points is disabled for wireless network connections.

ISM-1316.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1316.description: Default SSIDs of wireless access points are changed.

ISM-1317.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1317.description: SSIDs of non-public wireless networks are not readily associated with an organisation, the location of their premises or the functionality of wireless networks.

ISM-1318.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1318.description: SSID broadcasting is not disabled on wireless access points.

ISM-1319.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1319.description: Static addressing is not used for assigning IP addresses on wireless networks.

ISM-1320.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1320.description: MAC address filtering is not used to restrict which devices can connect to wireless networks.

ISM-1321.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1321.description: 802.1X authentication with EAP-TLS, using X.509 certificates, is used for mutual authentication; with all other EAP methods disabled on supplicants and authentication servers.

ISM-1322.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1322.description: Evaluated supplicants, authenticators, wireless access points and authentication servers are used in wireless networks.

ISM-1323.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1323.description: Certificates are required for devices and users accessing wireless networks.

ISM-1324.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1324.description: Certificates are generated using an evaluated certificate authority or hardware security module.

ISM-1327.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1327.description: Certificates are protected by logical and physical access controls, encryption, and user authentication.

ISM-1330.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1330.description: The PMK caching period is not set to greater than 1440 minutes (24 hours).

ISM-1332.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1332.description: WPA3-Enterprise 192-bit mode is used to protect the confidentiality and integrity of all wireless network traffic.

ISM-1334.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1334.description: Wireless networks implement sufficient frequency separation from other wireless networks.

ISM-1335.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1335.description: Wireless access points enable the use of the 802.11w amendment to protect management frames.

ISM-1338.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1338.description: Instead of deploying a small number of wireless access points that broadcast on high power, a greater number of wireless access points that use less broadcast power are deployed to achieve the desired footprint for wireless networks.

ISM-1341.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1341.description: A HIPS is implemented on workstations.

ISM-1359.name: Media usage
ISM-1359.description: A removable media usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1361.name: Media destruction
ISM-1361.description: Security Construction and Equipment Committee-approved equipment or ASIO-approved equipment is used when destroying media.

ISM-1364.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1364.description: Network devices managing VLANs terminate VLANs belonging to different security domains on separate physical network interfaces.

ISM-1366.name: Mobile device management
ISM-1366.description: Security updates are applied to mobile devices as soon as they become available.

ISM-1369.name: Transport Layer Security
ISM-1369.description: AES-GCM is used for encryption of TLS connections.

ISM-1370.name: Transport Layer Security
ISM-1370.description: Only server-initiated secure renegotiation is used for TLS connections.

ISM-1372.name: Transport Layer Security
ISM-1372.description: DH or ECDH is used for key establishment of TLS connections.

ISM-1373.name: Transport Layer Security
ISM-1373.description: Anonymous DH is not used for TLS connections.

ISM-1374.name: Transport Layer Security
ISM-1374.description: SHA-2-based certificates are used for TLS connections.

ISM-1375.name: Transport Layer Security
ISM-1375.description: SHA-2 is used for the Hash-based Message Authentication Code (HMAC) and pseudorandom function (PRF) for TLS connections.

ISM-1380.name: System administration
ISM-1380.description: Privileged users use separate privileged and unprivileged operating environments.

ISM-1385.name: System administration
ISM-1385.description: Administrative infrastructure is segregated from the wider network and the internet.

ISM-1386.name: System administration
ISM-1386.description: Network management traffic can only originate from administrative infrastructure.

ISM-1387.name: System administration
ISM-1387.description: Administrative activities are conducted through jump servers.

ISM-1389.name: Content filtering
ISM-1389.description: Executable files imported via gateways or CDSs are automatically executed in a sandbox to detect any suspicious behaviour.

ISM-1392.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1392.description: When implementing application control using path rules, only approved users can modify approved files and write to approved folders.

ISM-1395.name: Managed services and cloud services
ISM-1395.description: Service providers, including any subcontractors, provide an appropriate level of protection for any data entrusted to them or their services.

ISM-1400.name: Enterprise mobility
ISM-1400.description: Personnel accessing OFFICIAL: Sensitive or PROTECTED systems or data using privately-owned mobile devices or desktop computers have enforced separation of work data from personal data.

ISM-1401.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1401.description: Multi-factor authentication uses either: something users have and something users know, or something users have that is unlocked by something users know or are.

ISM-1402.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1402.description: Credentials stored on systems are protected by a password manager; a hardware security module; or by salting, hashing and stretching them before storage within a database.

ISM-1403.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1403.description: Accounts, except for break glass accounts, are locked out after a maximum of five failed logon attempts.

ISM-1404.name: Access to systems and their resources
ISM-1404.description: Unprivileged access to systems and applications is disabled after 45 days of inactivity.

ISM-1405.name: Event logging and monitoring
ISM-1405.description: A centralised event logging facility is implemented and event logs are sent to the facility as soon as possible after they occur.

ISM-1406.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1406.description: SOEs are used for workstations and servers.

ISM-1407.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1407.description: The latest release, or the previous release, of operating systems are used.

ISM-1408.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1408.description: Where supported, 64-bit versions of operating systems are used.

ISM-1409.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1409.description: Operating systems are hardened using ASD and vendor hardening guidance, with the most restrictive guidance taking precedence when conflicts occur.

ISM-1412.name: User application hardening
ISM-1412.description: Web browsers are hardened using ASD and vendor hardening guidance, with the most restrictive guidance taking precedence when conflicts occur.

ISM-1416.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1416.description: A software firewall is implemented on workstations and servers to restrict inbound and outbound network connections to an organisation-approved set of applications and services.

ISM-1417.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1417.description:
Antivirus software is implemented on workstations and servers with:
 • signature-based detection functionality enabled and set to a high level
 • heuristic-based detection functionality enabled and set to a high level
 • reputation rating functionality enabled
 • ransomware protection functionality enabled
 • detection signatures configured to update on at least a daily basis
 • regular scanning configured for all fixed disks and removable media.

ISM-1418.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1418.description: If there is no business requirement for reading from removable media and devices, such functionality is disabled via the use of device access control software or by disabling external communication interfaces.

ISM-1419.name: Application development
ISM-1419.description: Development and modification of software only takes place in development environments.

ISM-1420.name: Application development
ISM-1420.description: Data from production environments is not used in a development or testing environment unless the environment is secured to the same level as the production environment.

ISM-1422.name: Application development
ISM-1422.description: Unauthorised access to the authoritative source for software is prevented.

ISM-1424.name: Web application development
ISM-1424.description: Web applications implement Content-Security-Policy, HSTS and X-Frame-Options via security policy in response headers.

ISM-1427.name: Gateways
ISM-1427.description: Gateways perform ingress traffic filtering to detect and prevent IP source address spoofing.

ISM-1428.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1428.description: Unless explicitly required, IPv6 tunnelling is disabled on all network devices.

ISM-1429.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1429.description: IPv6 tunnelling is blocked by network security appliances at externally-connected network boundaries.

ISM-1430.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1430.description: Dynamically assigned IPv6 addresses are configured with Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol version 6 in a stateful manner with lease data stored in a centralised event logging facility.

ISM-1431.name: Service continuity for online services
ISM-1431.description:
Denial-of-service attack mitigation strategies are discussed with cloud service providers, specifically:
 • their capacity to withstand denial-of-service attacks
 • costs likely to be incurred as a result of denial-of-service attacks
 • availability monitoring and thresholds for notification of denial-of-service attacks
 • thresholds for turning off any online services or functionality during denial-of-service attacks
 • pre-approved actions that can be undertaken during denial-of-service attacks
 • any arrangements with upstream service providers to block malicious network traffic as far upstream as possible.

ISM-1432.name: Service continuity for online services
ISM-1432.description: Domain names for online services are protected via registrar locking and confirming that domain registration details are correct.

ISM-1436.name: Service continuity for online services
ISM-1436.description: Critical online services are segregated from other online services that are more likely to be targeted as part of denial-of-service attacks.

ISM-1437.name: Service continuity for online services
ISM-1437.description: Cloud service providers are used for hosting online services.

ISM-1438.name: Service continuity for online services
ISM-1438.description: Where a high availability requirement exists for website hosting, CDNs that cache websites are used.

ISM-1439.name: Service continuity for online services
ISM-1439.description: If using CDNs, disclosing the IP addresses of web servers under an organisation’s control (referred to as origin servers) is avoided and access to the origin servers is restricted to the CDNs and authorised management networks.

ISM-1446.name: ASD-Approved Cryptographic Algorithms
ISM-1446.description: When using elliptic curve cryptography, a suitable curve from NIST SP 800-186 is used.

ISM-1448.name: Transport Layer Security
ISM-1448.description: When using DH or ECDH for key establishment of TLS connections, the ephemeral variant is used.

ISM-1449.name: Secure Shell
ISM-1449.description: SSH private keys are protected with a passphrase or a key encryption key.

ISM-1450.name: Video conferencing and Internet Protocol telephony
ISM-1450.description: Microphones (including headsets and USB handsets) and webcams are not used with non-TOP SECRET workstations in TOP SECRET areas.

ISM-1451.name: Managed services and cloud services
ISM-1451.description: Types of data and its ownership is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

ISM-1452.name: Cyber supply chain risk management
ISM-1452.description: A supply chain risk assessment is performed for suppliers of applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services in order to assess the impact to a system’s security risk profile.

ISM-1453.name: Transport Layer Security
ISM-1453.description: Perfect Forward Secrecy (PFS) is used for TLS connections.

ISM-1454.name: Wireless networks
ISM-1454.description: Communications between authenticators and a RADIUS server are encapsulated with an additional layer of encryption using RADIUS over Internet Protocol Security or RADIUS over Transport Layer Security.

ISM-1457.name: Peripheral switches
ISM-1457.description: Evaluated peripheral switches used for sharing peripherals between SECRET and TOP SECRET systems, or between SECRET or TOP SECRET systems belonging to different security domains, preferably complete a high assurance evaluation.

ISM-1460.name: Virtualisation hardening
ISM-1460.description: When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware, the isolation mechanism is from a vendor that has demonstrated a commitment to secure-by-design and secure-by-default principles, use of memory-safe programming languages where possible, secure programming practices, and maintaining the security of their products.

ISM-1461.name: Virtualisation hardening
ISM-1461.description: When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware for SECRET or TOP SECRET computing environments, the physical server and all computing environments are of the same classification and belong to the same security domain.

ISM-1467.name: User application hardening
ISM-1467.description: The latest release of office productivity suites, web browsers and their extensions, email clients, PDF software, and security products are used.

ISM-1470.name: User application hardening
ISM-1470.description: Unneeded components, services and functionality of office productivity suites, web browsers, email clients, PDF software and security products are disabled or removed.

ISM-1471.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1471.description: When implementing application control using publisher certificate rules, publisher names and product names are used.

ISM-1478.name: Chief Information Security Officer
ISM-1478.description: The CISO oversees their organisation’s cyber security program and ensures their organisation’s compliance with cyber security policy, standards, regulations and legislation.

ISM-1479.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1479.description: Servers minimise communications with other servers at the network and file system level.

ISM-1480.name: Peripheral switches
ISM-1480.description: Evaluated peripheral switches used for sharing peripherals between SECRET or TOP SECRET systems and any non-SECRET or TOP SECRET systems complete a high assurance evaluation.

ISM-1482.name: Enterprise mobility
ISM-1482.description: Personnel accessing systems or data using an organisation-owned mobile device or desktop computer are either prohibited from using it for personal purposes or have enforced separation of work data from any personal data.

ISM-1483.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1483.description: The latest release of internet-facing server applications are used.

ISM-1485.name: User application hardening
ISM-1485.description: Web browsers do not process web advertisements from the internet.

ISM-1486.name: User application hardening
ISM-1486.description: Web browsers do not process Java from the internet.

ISM-1487.name: User application hardening
ISM-1487.description: Only privileged users responsible for checking that Microsoft Office macros are free of malicious code can write to and modify content within Trusted Locations.

ISM-1488.name: User application hardening
ISM-1488.description: Microsoft Office macros in files originating from the internet are blocked.

ISM-1489.name: User application hardening
ISM-1489.description: Microsoft Office macro security settings cannot be changed by users.

ISM-1490.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1490.description: Application control is implemented on internet-facing servers.

ISM-1491.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1491.description:
Unprivileged users are prevented from running script execution engines, including:
 • Windows Script Host (cscript.exe and wscript.exe)
 • PowerShell (powershell.exe, powershell_ise.exe and pwsh.exe)
 • Command Prompt (cmd.exe)
 • Windows Management Instrumentation (wmic.exe)
 • Microsoft Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) Application Host (mshta.exe).

ISM-1492.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1492.description: Operating system exploit protection functionality is enabled.

ISM-1493.name: System patching
ISM-1493.description: Software registers for workstations, servers, network devices and other IT equipment are developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

ISM-1501.name: System patching
ISM-1501.description: Operating systems that are no longer supported by vendors are replaced.

ISM-1502.name: Email gateways and servers
ISM-1502.description: Emails arriving via an external connection where the email source address uses an internal domain, or internal subdomain, are blocked at the email gateway.

ISM-1504.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1504.description: Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate users to their organisation’s online services that process, store or communicate their organisation’s sensitive data.

ISM-1505.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1505.description: Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate users of data repositories.

ISM-1506.name: Secure Shell
ISM-1506.description: The use of SSH version 1 is disabled for SSH connections.

ISM-1507.name: Access to systems and their resources
ISM-1507.description: Requests for privileged access to systems, applications and data repositories are validated when first requested.

ISM-1508.name: Access to systems and their resources
ISM-1508.description: Privileged access to systems, applications and data repositories is limited to only what is required for users and services to undertake their duties.

ISM-1509.name: Access to systems and their resources
ISM-1509.description: Privileged access events are centrally logged.

ISM-1510.name: Data backup and restoration
ISM-1510.description: A digital preservation policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1511.name: Data backup and restoration
ISM-1511.description: Backups of data, applications and settings are performed and retained in accordance with business criticality and business continuity requirements.

ISM-1515.name: Data backup and restoration
ISM-1515.description: Restoration of data, applications and settings from backups to a common point in time is tested as part of disaster recovery exercises.

ISM-1517.name: Media destruction
ISM-1517.description: Equipment that is capable of reducing microform to a fine powder, with resultant particles not showing more than five consecutive characters per particle upon microscopic inspection, is used to destroy microfiche and microfilm.

ISM-1520.name: Gateways
ISM-1520.description: System administrators for gateways undergo appropriate employment screening, and where necessary hold an appropriate security clearance, based on the sensitivity or classification of gateways.

ISM-1521.name: Cross Domain Solutions
ISM-1521.description: CDSs implement protocol breaks at each network layer.

ISM-1522.name: Cross Domain Solutions
ISM-1522.description: CDSs implement independent security-enforcing functions for upward and downward network paths.

ISM-1523.name: Cross Domain Solutions
ISM-1523.description: A sample of security-relevant events relating to data transfer policies are taken at least every three months and assessed against security policies for CDSs to identify any operational failures.

ISM-1524.name: Content filtering
ISM-1524.description: Content filters used by CDSs undergo rigorous security testing to ensure they perform as expected and cannot be bypassed.

ISM-1525.name: System owners
ISM-1525.description: System owners register each system with its authorising officer.

ISM-1526.name: System owners
ISM-1526.description: System owners monitor each system, and associated cyber threats, security risks and controls, on an ongoing basis.

ISM-1528.name: Firewalls
ISM-1528.description: Evaluated firewalls are used between an organisation’s networks and public network infrastructure.

ISM-1529.name: Managed services and cloud services
ISM-1529.description: Only community or private clouds are used for outsourced SECRET and TOP SECRET cloud services.

ISM-1530.name: Facilities and systems
ISM-1530.description: Servers, network devices and cryptographic equipment are secured in security containers or secure rooms suitable for their classification taking into account the combination of security zones they reside in.

ISM-1532.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1532.description: VLANs are not used to separate network traffic between an organisation’s networks and public network infrastructure.

ISM-1533.name: Mobile device management
ISM-1533.description: A mobile device management policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1534.name: IT equipment sanitisation and destruction
ISM-1534.description: Printer ribbons in printers and MFDs are removed and destroyed.

ISM-1535.name: Data transfers
ISM-1535.description: Processes, and supporting procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained to prevent AUSTEO, AGAO and REL data in textual and non-textual formats from being exported to unsuitable foreign systems.

ISM-1536.name: Web application development
ISM-1536.description: All queries to databases from web applications that are initiated by users, and any resulting crash or error messages, are centrally logged.

ISM-1537.name: Databases
ISM-1537.description:
The following events are centrally logged for databases:
 • access or modification of particularly important content
 • addition of new users, especially privileged users
 • changes to user roles or privileges
 • attempts to elevate user privileges
 • queries containing comments
 • queries containing multiple embedded queries
 • database and query alerts or failures
 • database structure changes
 • database administrator actions
 • use of executable commands
 • database logons and logoffs.

ISM-1540.name: Email gateways and servers
ISM-1540.description: DMARC records are configured for an organisation’s domains (including subdomains) such that emails are rejected if they do not pass DMARC checks.

ISM-1542.name: User application hardening
ISM-1542.description: Microsoft Office is configured to prevent activation of Object Linking and Embedding packages.

ISM-1543.name: Facilities and systems
ISM-1543.description: An authorised RF and IR device register for SECRET and TOP SECRET areas is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

ISM-1544.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1544.description: Microsoft’s recommended application blocklist is implemented.

ISM-1546.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1546.description: Users are authenticated before they are granted access to a system and its resources.

ISM-1547.name: Data backup and restoration
ISM-1547.description: Data backup processes, and supporting data backup procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1548.name: Data backup and restoration
ISM-1548.description: Data restoration processes, and supporting data restoration procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1549.name: Media usage
ISM-1549.description: A media management policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1550.name: IT equipment disposal
ISM-1550.description: IT equipment disposal processes, and supporting IT equipment disposal procedures, are developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1551.name: IT equipment usage
ISM-1551.description: An IT equipment management policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1552.name: Web application development
ISM-1552.description: All web application content is offered exclusively using HTTPS.

ISM-1553.name: Transport Layer Security
ISM-1553.description: TLS compression is disabled for TLS connections.

ISM-1554.name: Mobile device usage
ISM-1554.description:
If travelling overseas with mobile devices to high or extreme risk countries, personnel are:
 • issued with newly provisioned accounts, mobile devices and removable media from a pool of dedicated travel devices which are used solely for work-related activities
 • advised on how to apply and inspect tamper seals to key areas of mobile devices
 • advised to avoid taking any personal mobile devices, especially if rooted or jailbroken.

ISM-1555.name: Mobile device usage
ISM-1555.description:
Before travelling overseas with mobile devices, personnel take the following actions:
 • record all details of the mobile devices being taken, such as product types, serial numbers and International Mobile Equipment Identity numbers
 • update all operating systems and applications
 • remove all non-essential data, applications and accounts
 • backup all remaining data, applications and settings.

ISM-1556.name: Mobile device usage
ISM-1556.description:
If returning from travelling overseas with mobile devices to high or extreme risk countries, personnel take the following additional actions:
 • reset credentials used with mobile devices, including those used for remote access to their organisation’s systems
 • monitor accounts for any indicators of compromise, such as failed logon attempts.

ISM-1557.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1557.description: Passphrases used for single-factor authentication on SECRET systems are at least 5 random words with a total minimum length of 17 characters.

ISM-1558.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1558.description: Passphrases used for single-factor authentication are not a list of categorised words; do not form a real sentence in a natural language; and are not constructed from song lyrics, movies, literature or any other publicly available material.

ISM-1559.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1559.description: Memorised secrets used for multi-factor authentication are a minimum of 6 characters, unless more stringent requirements apply.

ISM-1560.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1560.description: Memorised secrets used for multi-factor authentication on SECRET systems are a minimum of 8 characters.

ISM-1561.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1561.description: Memorised secrets used for multi-factor authentication on TOP SECRET systems are a minimum of 10 characters.

ISM-1562.name: Video conferencing and Internet Protocol telephony
ISM-1562.description: Video conferencing and IP telephony infrastructure is hardened.

ISM-1563.name: System-specific security documentation
ISM-1563.description:
At the conclusion of a security assessment for a system, a security assessment report is produced by the assessor and covers:
 • the scope of the security assessment
 • the system’s strengths and weaknesses
 • security risks associated with the operation of the system
 • the effectiveness of the implementation of controls
 • any recommended remediation actions.

ISM-1564.name: System-specific security documentation
ISM-1564.description: At the conclusion of a security assessment for a system, a plan of action and milestones is produced by the system owner.

ISM-1565.name: Cyber security awareness training
ISM-1565.description: Tailored privileged user training is undertaken annually by all privileged users.

ISM-1566.name: Access to systems and their resources
ISM-1566.description: Use of unprivileged access is centrally logged.

ISM-1567.name: Cyber supply chain risk management
ISM-1567.description: Suppliers identified as high risk by a cyber supply chain risk assessment are not used.

ISM-1568.name: Cyber supply chain risk management
ISM-1568.description: Applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are chosen from suppliers that have demonstrated a commitment to the security of their products and services.

ISM-1569.name: Cyber supply chain risk management
ISM-1569.description: A shared responsibility model is created, documented and shared between suppliers and their customers in order to articulate the security responsibilities of each party.

ISM-1570.name: Managed services and cloud services
ISM-1570.description: Outsourced cloud service providers and their cloud services undergo a security assessment by an IRAP assessor at least every 24 months.

ISM-1571.name: Managed services and cloud services
ISM-1571.description: The right to verify compliance with security requirements is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

ISM-1572.name: Managed services and cloud services
ISM-1572.description: The regions or availability zones where data will be processed, stored and communicated, as well as a minimum notification period for any configuration changes, is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

ISM-1573.name: Managed services and cloud services
ISM-1573.description: Access to all logs relating to an organisation’s data and services is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

ISM-1574.name: Managed services and cloud services
ISM-1574.description: The storage of data in a portable manner that allows for backups, service migration and service decommissioning without any loss of data is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

ISM-1575.name: Managed services and cloud services
ISM-1575.description: A minimum notification period of one month for the cessation of any services by a service provider is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

ISM-1576.name: Managed services and cloud services
ISM-1576.description: If an organisation’s systems, applications or data are accessed or administered by a service provider in an unauthorised manner, the organisation is immediately notified.

ISM-1577.name: Network design and configuration

ISM-1786.name: Cyber supply chain risk management
ISM-1786.description: An approved supplier list is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1788.description: Multiple potential suppliers are identified for sourcing critical applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services.

ISM-1789.name: Cyber supply chain risk management
ISM-1789.description: Sufficient spares of critical IT equipment and OT equipment are sourced and kept in reserve.

ISM-1790.name: Cyber supply chain risk management
ISM-1790.description: Applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are delivered in a manner that maintains their integrity.

ISM-1791.name: Cyber supply chain risk management

ISM-1794.name: Managed services and cloud services
ISM-1794.description: A minimum notification period of one month by service providers for significant changes to their own service provider arrangements is documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

ISM-1795.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1795.description: Credentials for break glass accounts, local administrator accounts and service accounts are a minimum of 30 characters.

ISM-1796.name: Application development
