ISM-1797.name: Application development
ISM-1797.description: Installers, patches and updates are digitally signed or provided with cryptographic checksums as part of application development.

ISM-1798.name: Application development
ISM-1798.description: Secure configuration guidance is produced as part of application development.

ISM-1799.name: Email gateways and servers
ISM-1799.description: Incoming emails are rejected if they do not pass DMARC checks.

ISM-1800.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1800.description: Network devices are flashed with trusted firmware before they are used for the first time.

ISM-1801.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1801.description: Network devices are restarted on at least a monthly basis.

ISM-1802.name: Cryptographic fundamentals
ISM-1802.description: HACE are issued an Approval for Use by ASD and operated in accordance with the latest version of their associated Australian Communications Security Instructions.

ISM-1803.name: Managing cyber security incidents
ISM-1803.description:
A cyber security incident register contains the following for each cyber security incident:
 • the date the cyber security incident occurred
 • the date the cyber security incident was discovered
 • a description of the cyber security incident
 • any actions taken in response to the cyber security incident
 • to whom the cyber security incident was reported.

ISM-1804.name: Managed services and cloud services
ISM-1804.description: Break clauses associated with failure to meet security requirements are documented in contractual arrangements with service providers.

ISM-1805.name: Video conferencing and Internet Protocol telephony
ISM-1805.description:
A denial of service response plan for video conferencing and IP telephony services contains the following:
 • how to identify signs of a denial-of-service attack
 • how to identify the source of a denial-of-service attack
 • how capabilities can be maintained during a denial-of-service attack
 • what actions can be taken to respond to a denial-of-service attack.

ISM-1806.name: User application hardening
ISM-1806.description: Default accounts or credentials for user applications, including for any pre-configured accounts, are changed.

ISM-1807.name: System patching
ISM-1807.description: An automated method of asset discovery is used at least fortnightly to support the detection of assets for subsequent vulnerability scanning activities.

ISM-1808.name: System patching
ISM-1808.description: A vulnerability scanner with an up-to-date vulnerability database is used for vulnerability scanning activities.

ISM-1809.name: System patching
ISM-1809.description: When applications, operating systems, network devices or other IT equipment that are no longer supported by vendors cannot be immediately removed or replaced, compensating controls are implemented until such time that they can be removed or replaced.

ISM-1810.name: Data backup and restoration
ISM-1810.description: Backups of data, applications and settings are synchronised to enable restoration to a common point in time.

ISM-1811.name: Data backup and restoration
ISM-1811.description: Backups of data, applications and settings are retained in a secure and resilient manner.

ISM-1812.name: Data backup and restoration
ISM-1812.description: Unprivileged accounts cannot access backups belonging to other accounts.

ISM-1813.name: Data backup and restoration
ISM-1813.description: Unprivileged accounts cannot access their own backups.

ISM-1814.name: Data backup and restoration
ISM-1814.description: Unprivileged accounts are prevented from modifying and deleting backups.

ISM-1815.name: Event logging and monitoring
ISM-1815.description: Event logs are protected from unauthorised modification and deletion.

ISM-1816.name: Application development
ISM-1816.description: Unauthorised modification of the authoritative source for software is prevented.

ISM-1817.name: Web application development
ISM-1817.description: Authentication and authorisation of clients is performed when clients call web APIs that facilitate access to data not authorised for release into the public domain.

ISM-1818.name: Web application development
ISM-1818.description: Authentication and authorisation of clients is performed when clients call web APIs that facilitate modification of data.

ISM-1819.name: Responding to cyber security incidents
ISM-1819.description: Following the identification of a cyber security incident, the cyber security incident response plan is enacted.

ISM-1820.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1820.description: Cables for individual systems use a consistent colour.

ISM-1821.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1821.description: TOP SECRET cables, when bundled together or run in conduit, are run exclusively in their own individual cable bundle or conduit.

ISM-1822.name: Cabling infrastructure
ISM-1822.description: Wall outlet boxes for individual systems use a consistent colour.

ISM-1823.name: User application hardening
ISM-1823.description: Office productivity suite security settings cannot be changed by users.

ISM-1824.name: User application hardening
ISM-1824.description: PDF software security settings cannot be changed by users.

ISM-1825.name: User application hardening
ISM-1825.description: Security product security settings cannot be changed by users.

ISM-1826.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1826.description: Server applications are chosen from vendors that have demonstrated a commitment to secure-by-design and secure-by-default principles, use of memory-safe programming languages where possible, secure programming practices, and maintaining the security of their products.

ISM-1827.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1827.description: Microsoft AD DS domain controllers are administered using dedicated domain administrator user accounts that are not used to administer other systems.

ISM-1828.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1828.description: The Print Spooler service is disabled on Microsoft AD DS domain controllers.

ISM-1829.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1829.description: Passwords and cpasswords are not used in Group Policy Preferences.

ISM-1830.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1830.description: Security-related events for Microsoft AD DS are centrally logged.

ISM-1832.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1832.description: Only service accounts and computer accounts are configured with Service Principal Names (SPNs).

ISM-1833.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1833.description: Service accounts are provisioned with the minimum privileges required and are not members of the domain administrators group or similar highly privileged groups.

ISM-1834.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1834.description: Duplicate SPNs do not exist within the domain.

ISM-1835.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1835.description: Privileged user accounts are configured as sensitive and cannot be delegated.

ISM-1837.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1837.description: User accounts are not configured with password never expires or password not required.

ISM-1838.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1838.description: The UserPassword attribute for user accounts is not used.

ISM-1839.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1839.description: Account properties accessible by unprivileged users are not used to store passwords.

ISM-1840.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1840.description: User account passwords do not use reversible encryption.

ISM-1841.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1841.description: Unprivileged user accounts cannot add machines to the domain.

ISM-1842.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1842.description: Dedicated service accounts are used to add machines to the domain.

ISM-1843.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1843.description: User accounts with unconstrained delegation are reviewed at least annually, and those without an associated Kerberos SPN or demonstrated business requirement are removed.

ISM-1844.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1844.description: Computer accounts that are not Microsoft AD DS domain controllers are not trusted for delegation to services.

ISM-1845.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1845.description: When a user account is disabled, it is removed from all security group memberships.

ISM-1846.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1846.description: The Pre-Windows 2000 Compatible Access security group does not contain user accounts.

ISM-1847.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1847.description:
Credentials for the Kerberos Key Distribution Center’s service account (KRBTGT) are changed twice, allowing for replication to all Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services domain controllers in-between each change, if:
 • the domain has been directly compromised
 • the domain is suspected of being compromised
 • they have not been changed in the past 12 months.

ISM-1848.name: Virtualisation hardening
ISM-1848.description: When using a software-based isolation mechanism to share a physical server’s hardware, the isolation mechanism or underlying operating system is replaced when it is no longer supported by a vendor.

ISM-1849.name: Web application development
ISM-1849.description: The OWASP Top 10 Proactive Controls are used in the development of web applications.

ISM-1850.name: Web application development
ISM-1850.description: The OWASP Top 10 are mitigated in the development of web applications.

ISM-1851.name: Web application development
ISM-1851.description: The OWASP API Security Top 10 are mitigated in the development of web APIs.

ISM-1852.name: Access to systems and their resources
ISM-1852.description: Unprivileged access to systems, applications and data repositories is limited to only what is required for users and services to undertake their duties.

ISM-1854.name: Fax machines and multifunction devices
ISM-1854.description: Users authenticate to MFDs before they can print, scan or copy documents.

ISM-1855.name: Fax machines and multifunction devices
ISM-1855.description: Use of MFDs for printing, scanning and copying purposes, including the capture of shadow copies of documents, are centrally logged.

ISM-1857.name: IT equipment usage
ISM-1857.description: IT equipment is chosen from vendors that have demonstrated a commitment to secure-by-design and secure-by-default principles, use of memory-safe programming languages where possible, secure programming practices, and maintaining the security of their products.

ISM-1858.name: IT equipment usage
ISM-1858.description: IT equipment is hardened using ASD and vendor hardening guidance, with the most restrictive guidance taking precedence when conflicts occur.

ISM-1859.name: User application hardening
ISM-1859.description: Office productivity suites are hardened using ASD and vendor hardening guidance, with the most restrictive guidance taking precedence when conflicts occur.

ISM-1860.name: User application hardening
ISM-1860.description: PDF software is hardened using ASD and vendor hardening guidance, with the most restrictive guidance taking precedence when conflicts occur.

ISM-1861.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1861.description: Local Security Authority protection functionality is enabled.

ISM-1862.name: Web application development
ISM-1862.description: If using a WAF, disclosing the IP addresses of web servers under an organisation’s control (referred to as origin servers) is avoided and access to the origin servers is restricted to the WAF and authorised management networks.

ISM-1863.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1863.description: Networked management interfaces for IT equipment are not directly exposed to the internet.

ISM-1864.name: Access to systems and their resources
ISM-1864.description: A system usage policy is developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1865.name: Access to systems and their resources
ISM-1865.description: Personnel agree to abide by usage policies associated with a system and its resources before being granted access to the system and its resources.

ISM-1866.name: Enterprise mobility
ISM-1866.description: Personnel accessing OFFICIAL: Sensitive or PROTECTED systems or data using privately-owned mobile devices or desktop computers are prevented from storing classified data on their privately-owned mobile devices and desktop computers.

ISM-1867.name: Mobile device management
ISM-1867.description: Mobile devices that access OFFICIAL: Sensitive or PROTECTED systems or data use mobile platforms that have completed a Common Criteria evaluation against the Protection Profile for Mobile Device Fundamentals, version 3.3 or later, and are operated in accordance with the latest version of their associated ASD security configuration guide.

ISM-1868.name: Mobile device management
ISM-1868.description: SECRET and TOP SECRET mobile devices do not use removable media unless approved beforehand by ASD.

ISM-1869.name: IT equipment usage
ISM-1869.description: A non-networked IT equipment register is developed, implemented, maintained and verified on a regular basis.

ISM-1870.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1870.description: Application control is applied to user profiles and temporary folders used by operating systems, web browsers and email clients.

ISM-1871.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1871.description: Application control is applied to all locations other than user profiles and temporary folders used by operating systems, web browsers and email clients.

ISM-1872.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1872.description: Multi-factor authentication used for authenticating users of online services is phishing-resistant.

ISM-1873.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1873.description: Multi-factor authentication used for authenticating customers of online customer services provides a phishing-resistant option.

ISM-1874.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1874.description: Multi-factor authentication used for authenticating customers of online customer services is phishing-resistant.

ISM-1875.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1875.description: Networks are scanned at least monthly to identify any credentials that are being stored in the clear.

ISM-1876.name: System patching
ISM-1876.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in online services are applied within 48 hours of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as critical by vendors or when working exploits exist.

ISM-1877.name: System patching
ISM-1877.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in operating systems of internet-facing servers and internet-facing network devices are applied within 48 hours of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as critical by vendors or when working exploits exist.

ISM-1878.name: System patching
ISM-1878.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in operating systems of IT equipment other than workstations, servers and network devices are applied within 48 hours of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as critical by vendors or when working exploits exist.

ISM-1879.name: System patching
ISM-1879.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in drivers are applied within 48 hours of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as critical by vendors or when working exploits exist.

ISM-1880.name: Managing cyber security incidents
ISM-1880.description: Cyber security incidents that involve customer data are reported to customers and the public in a timely manner after they occur or are discovered.

ISM-1881.name: Managing cyber security incidents
ISM-1881.description: Cyber security incidents that do not involve customer data are reported to customers and the public in a timely manner after they occur or are discovered.

ISM-1882.name: Cyber supply chain risk management
ISM-1882.description: Applications, IT equipment, OT equipment and services are chosen from suppliers that have demonstrated a commitment to transparency for their products and services.

ISM-1883.name: Access to systems and their resources
ISM-1883.description: Privileged accounts explicitly authorised to access online services are strictly limited to only what is required for users and services to undertake their duties.

ISM-1884.name: Emanation security
ISM-1884.description: Emanation security doctrine produced by ASD for the management of emanation security matters is complied with.

ISM-1885.name: Emanation security
ISM-1885.description: Recommended actions contained within TEMPEST requirements statements issued for systems are implemented by system owners.

ISM-1886.name: Mobile device management
ISM-1886.description: Mobile devices are configured to operate in a supervised (or equivalent) mode.

ISM-1887.name: Mobile device management
ISM-1887.description: Mobile devices are configured with remote locate and wipe functionality.

ISM-1888.name: Mobile device management
ISM-1888.description: Mobile devices are configured with secure lock screens.

ISM-1889.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1889.description: Command line process creation events are centrally logged.

ISM-1890.name: User application hardening
ISM-1890.description: Microsoft Office macros are checked to ensure they are free of malicious code before being digitally signed or placed within Trusted Locations.

ISM-1891.name: User application hardening
ISM-1891.description: Microsoft Office macros digitally signed by signatures other than V3 signatures cannot be enabled via the Message Bar or Backstage View.

ISM-1892.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1892.description: Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate users to their organisation’s online customer services that process, store or communicate their organisation’s sensitive customer data.

ISM-1893.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1893.description: Multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate users to third-party online customer services that process, store or communicate their organisation’s sensitive customer data.

ISM-1894.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1894.description: Multi-factor authentication used for authenticating users of data repositories is phishing-resistant.

ISM-1895.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1895.description: Successful and unsuccessful single-factor authentication events are centrally logged.

ISM-1897.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1897.description: Remote Credential Guard functionality is enabled.

ISM-1898.name: System administration
ISM-1898.description: Secure Admin Workstations are used in the performance of administrative activities.

ISM-1899.name: System administration
ISM-1899.description: Network devices that do not belong to administrative infrastructure cannot initiate connections with administrative infrastructure.

ISM-1900.name: System patching
ISM-1900.description: A vulnerability scanner is used at least fortnightly to identify missing patches or updates for vulnerabilities in firmware.

ISM-1901.name: System patching
ISM-1901.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in office productivity suites, web browsers and their extensions, email clients, PDF software, and security products are applied within two weeks of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as non-critical by vendors and no working exploits exist.

ISM-1902.name: System patching
ISM-1902.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in operating systems of workstations, non-internet-facing servers and non-internet-facing network devices are applied within one month of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as non-critical by vendors and no working exploits exist.

ISM-1903.name: System patching
ISM-1903.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in firmware are applied within 48 hours of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as critical by vendors or when working exploits exist.

ISM-1904.name: System patching
ISM-1904.description: Patches, updates or other vendor mitigations for vulnerabilities in firmware are applied within one month of release when vulnerabilities are assessed as non-critical by vendors and no working exploits exist.

ISM-1905.name: System patching
ISM-1905.description: Online services that are no longer supported by vendors are removed.

ISM-1906.name: Event logging and monitoring
ISM-1906.description: Event logs from internet-facing servers are analysed in a timely manner to detect cyber security events.

ISM-1907.name: Event logging and monitoring
ISM-1907.description: Event logs from non-internet-facing servers are analysed in a timely manner to detect cyber security events.

ISM-1908.name: Application development
ISM-1908.description: Vulnerabilities identified in applications are publicly disclosed (where appropriate to do so) by software developers in a timely manner.

ISM-1909.name: Application development
ISM-1909.description: In resolving vulnerabilities, software developers perform root cause analysis and, to the greatest extent possible, seek to remediate entire vulnerability classes.

ISM-1910.name: Web application development
ISM-1910.description: Web API calls that facilitate modification of data, or access to data not authorised for release into the public domain, are centrally logged.

ISM-1911.name: Web application development
ISM-1911.description: Web application crashes and error messages are centrally logged.

ISM-1912.name: Network design and configuration
ISM-1912.description: Network documentation includes device settings for all critical servers, high-value servers, network devices and network security appliances.

ISM-1913.name: IT equipment usage
ISM-1913.description: Approved configurations for IT equipment are developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1914.name: Operating system hardening
ISM-1914.description: Approved configurations for operating systems are developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1915.name: User application hardening
ISM-1915.description: Approved configurations for user applications are developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1916.name: Server application hardening
ISM-1916.description: Approved configurations for server applications are developed, implemented and maintained.

ISM-1917.name: ASD-Approved Cryptographic Algorithms
ISM-1917.description: Future cryptographic requirements and dependencies are considered during the transition to post-quantum cryptographic standards.

ISM-1918.name: Chief Information Security Officer
ISM-1918.description: The CISO regularly reports directly to their organisation’s audit, risk and compliance committee (or equivalent) on cyber security matters.

ISM-1919.name: Authentication hardening
ISM-1919.description: When multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate users or customers to online services or online customer services, all other authentication protocols that do not support multi-factor authentication are disabled.

ISM-1920.description: When multi-factor authentication is used to authenticate users to online services, online customer services, systems or data repositories – that process, store or communicate their organisation’s sensitive data or sensitive customer data – users are prevented from self-enrolling into multi-factor authentication from untrustworthy devices.

ISM-1921.name: System patching
ISM-1921.description: The likelihood of system compromise is frequently assessed when working exploits exist for unmitigated vulnerabilities.

ISM-1922.name: Application development
ISM-1922.description: The Open Worldwide Application Security Project (OWASP) Mobile Application Security Verification Standard is used in the development of mobile applications.

ISM-1923.name: Application development
ISM-1923.description: The OWASP Top 10 for Large Language Model Applications are mitigated in the development of large language model applications.

ISM-1924.name: Application development
ISM-1924.description: Large language model applications evaluate the sentence perplexity of user prompts to detect and mitigate adversarial suffixes designed to assist in the generation of sensitive or harmful content.
